channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Middle East turmoil: Spain, Norway and Ireland to recognize a Palestinian state
item.description: Spain, Norway and Ireland have announced plans to formally recognize a Palestinian state, in a move that is likely to bolster the global Palestinian cause but strain relations with Israel. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs accused of 2003 sexual assault in lawsuit
item.description: A former model accused Sean “Diddy” Combs of sexually assaulting her at his New York City recording studio in 2003 in a lawsuit filed in the city

item.title: May 21, 2024 Israel-Hamas war, Iran president death news
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blasted the charges brought by the International Criminal Court against himself and Israel's defense minister as "beyond outrageous" in an interview Tuesday with CNN's Jake Tapper.

item.title: Biden slams video on Trump site citing 'Unified Reich,' Republicans dodge commenting
item.description: President Biden criticized Trump for his since-deleted social media post referencing a "Unified Reich" if reelected,

item.title: Both sides rest cases without Trump testifying in hush money trial
item.description: Donald Trump's New York criminal hush money trial has adjourned until next Tuesday, when closing arguments are expected to take place.

item.title: Iowa State Police confirm fatalities, injuries as tornadoes rip through counties
item.description: Gov. Reynolds authorized a proclamation of disaster emergency for 15 counties on Tuesday.

item.title: The latest on Singapore Airlines turbulence incident
item.description: One person has died and at least 71 others were injured on board a Singapore Airlines plane that encountered severe turbulence on a flight from London to Singapore. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Danish police temporarily ban the Bandidos motorcycle club, citing violence
item.description: Danish police have issued a temporary ban on the Danish arm of the Bandidos motorcycle club, citing the group’s violent behavior

item.title: 'There's nothing like it,' says kayaker Dane Jackson after descending 300 feet down waterfalls
item.description: When Dane Jackson turned around and looked back at the tower of frothing water above him, he could scarcely believe what he had just experienced.

item.title: Israel-Gaza live updates: 3 European countries to recognize Palestinian state
item.description: More than six months after Hamas terrorists invaded Israel on Oct. 7, the Israeli military continues its bombardment of the neighboring Gaza Strip.
